text: Juan Bautista Vitón (1780-1868) was a Spanish politician, who served in Buenos Aires as lieutenant in the Cuerpo de Voluntarios Artilleros de la Unión. == Biography == Vitón was born in Cádiz, son of Ramón Vitón and María Isabel Santibañez, belonging to a distinguished family of French and Spanish roots. He had arrived around the year 1800 to Buenos Aires. During the British invasions of the River Plate, he served as Lieutenant of artillery in the Cuerpo de Voluntarios Artilleros de la Unión, having an active participation in the battles against the English troops. Due to his opposition to the cause of May (May Revolution), Vitón was confined to La Rioja Province.
